intro: Koeleria chakassica, commonly known as the Chakassian grass, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the禾本科 (Poaceae) family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to thrive in well-drained, rocky soils. Koeleria chakassica is often found in alpine and steppe environments, where it contributes to the ecological stability of its habitat.
